sub_title: Seeking Opportunities in Science, Consulting and Education
summary:
Currently seeking Research & Development and Analytical Roles in Industrial Materials, Nanotechnology, Personal Care/Cosmetics, Pharmaceuticals, and Alternative Energy and Resources. 
Also interested in Instrument Applications, Laboratory Management, QC/QA, Science Communication & Education, as well as expanding into Strategy management and Consulting. 

I am a Materials Chemist with experience in Research and Analysis:
- Synthetic design and characterisation of novel materials 
- Big Data processing, analysis and interpretation
- Problem-solving and analytical thinking
- Oral and written communication (report writing, presentations)
- Teamwork and collaborations with local and international research groups
- Microsoft Office suite
- Operating a wide range of analytical instruments with different configurations
- Worked in National Synchrotron and Neutron facilities

As a Passionate Science Educator, I can:
- Effectively communicate complex theories and procedures in a simple, illustrative manner
- Provide support and solutions by troubleshooting experimental and instrumentation complications
- Manage large group of students and a small team of demonstrators
- Monitor, assess and improve OH&S guidelines and laboratory teaching materials
- Demonstrate the use safe and correct use of laboratory equipments and instruments
- Prepare and organise laboratory setup for different teaching programs
- Student-Academic liaison with the aim to improve student learning experience

I am also a Cosmetics and Skin Care Enthusiast:
- DIY projects including formulating and documenting new nail polish colours and types, and facial cleansing oil mixtures
- Collecting, testing, comparing and reviewing different brands and types of products

I am artistic and creative with interest in many traditional art disciplines and materials.

projects.title: Metal-Organic Frameworks with Bare Metal Sites for Hydrogen Storage.
projects.description:
- Synthesis of existing and new framework materials through Crystal Engineering with Solvothermal and Microwave techniques
- Batch purity test using PXRD, TGA, IR, AAS, SEM/EDX
- Structural characterisation using Single-Crystal and Powder X-ray Diffraction
- Surface area (N2/Ar) and H2 sorption and Enthalpy of adsorption studies 
- Neutron diffraction with Deuterium loading to determine gas binding sites at NIST and ANSTO
- Compare experimental results with computational models for validation

contributors.headline: Seeking Opportunities in Science, Consulting and Education

projects.title: Probing the Mechanisms of Thermal Expansion in UiO-66 and analogues.
projects.description:
- Synthesis, functionalisation and In-situ modification of existing and new framework materials for Zero and Negative Thermal Expansion properties
- Preliminary thermal expansion studies using Variable-Temperature PXRD, IR/Raman Spectroscopy, and Surface Area measurements
- High-resolution VT-PXRD studies at the Australian Synchrotron
- Big data extraction and analysis from Rietveld Structural Refinement results
- Regression analysis of thermal expansion coefficients
- Computational calculation of vibrational frequencies and optimised structures

contributors.headline: Seeking Opportunities in Science, Consulting and Education

company.name: School of Chemistry, The University of Sydney

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

- Assist students in understanding the laboratory program in relation to their coursework
- Assessing and monitoring the safety of students and their working environment
- Incident management involving emergency clean-up and disposal of hazardous chemicals spills
- Demonstrating complex experimental set-up and the use of analytical instruments
- Contributing to the improvement of existing and new laboratory protocols and OH&S guidelines 
- Inspire and mentor students to become quality scientists and researchers

Skills Gained:
- Time management and work prioritisation
- Troubleshooting experimental mishaps
- Technical and theoretical knowledge and maintenance of a wide range of scientific instruments (AAS, GC, IC, FTIR, UV-Vis Spectroscopy, Conductometry, Electrochemistry, Polarimetry)
profile_positions.title: Senior Chemistry Laboratory Demonstrator

profile_positions.description:
Including: High School Kickstart Chemistry Workshop, Workshops for Chemistry Teachers, Gifted and Talented Program and various Faculty of Science Outreach Programs

Responsibilities:
- Preparing and organising laboratory equipment and instruments for required programs
- Demonstrating the correct and safe use of equipment to large audiences
- Explaining and teaching the theory and science behind the experiments involved
- Managing large group of students (over 100)
- Supervising and training of junior demonstrators 

Skills Gained:
- Extensive knowledge of the NSW HSC Chemistry syllabus
- Strong leadership, organisational and multitasking skills
- Excellent teaching and presentation experience
- Improvement and designing new experiments and teaching methods
profile_positions.title: Senior Laboratory Demonstrator for Outreach Programs
